title: Gunmen Storm Mogadishu Hotel, Trapping Government Officials
description: An extremist group, Al Shabab, claimed responsibility for the attack at the hotel in the Somali capital. There were few immediate reports of casualties, but the siege was still underway.

title: Landslide Kills at Least 14 at Funeral in Cameroon
description: Rescuers were still searching for people who might have been swept up in the disaster.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Covid Protests Intensify in China
description: Plus World Cup updates, Kiribati’s judicial shake-up and “Gangnam Style,” 10 years later.

title: After Belgium’s Loss to Morocco, Violence Breaks Out in Brussels
description: The violence erupted after Morocco upset Belgium, 2-0, at the World Cup.

title: Ukraine’s Progress Threatened by the Challenges of Winter Weather
description: Officials urged Ukrainians to continue conserving energy, as analysts said that deteriorating weather was one factor slowing Ukraine’s battlefield progress.

title: Roman Coins Thought for Centuries to Be Fakes Get a Fresh Appraisal
description: New research suggests that the gold coins, which were found in 1713 and long dismissed as forgeries, may be authentic.

title: In Ukraine, Bakhmut Becomes a Bloody Vortex for 2 Militaries
description: Even as they have celebrated successes elsewhere, Ukrainian forces in one small eastern city have endured relentless Russian attacks. And the struggle to hold it is only intensifying.

title: Deadly Blaze in China Fuels Defiance Against Xi’s Covid Policies
description: Protests became rare once the government cut off most routes to collective action. But ubiquitous Covid rules, bringing shared suffering, have created a focus for anger.

title: Cholera and Crime
description: Haiti is in the midst of a humanitarian disaster.

title: ​How Britain Turned ‘Modern Slavery’ Law Against Low-Level Drug Dealers
description: A law written to prevent human trafficking is being wielded against low-level drug dealers. The effects are long-lasting.

title: Beauty Over Brains: Japan’s Skin-Deep University Pageants
description: The contests reflect a culture that often judges women by their appearance and slots them into rigid, gender-defined roles.

title: French Police Guard Water as Seasonal Drought Intensifies
description: New reservoirs designed to supply French farms with water in increasingly arid growing seasons have attracted opposition from environmentalists.

title: Amid Israeli Blockade on Gaza, a Fishing Fleet Limps Along
description: An Israeli blockade that restricts the movement of Gazans out of the strip and limits imports — or bans them completely — has been devastating for the enclave’s fishing industry.
